snippet: Bank officials are expected to belatedly follow the recommendation of a group of shareholder advocates to strengthen the board committee that oversees risk.
abstract: CtW Investment Group, a small group of shareholder advocates, warned JPMorgan Chase in April 2011 that the bank's risk controls needed to be improved; bank officials, after disclosing a $2 billion trading loss in May, are expected to follow one of the group's recommendations, strengthening the board panel that oversees risk.

byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

lead_paragraph: Bank officials are expected to belatedly follow the recommendation of a group of shareholder advocates to strengthen the board committee that oversees risk.

headline.seo: JPMorgan Ignored Warning on Risk Control
headline.main: JPMorgan Was Warned About Lax Risk Controls
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Was Warned About Lax Risk Controls
